design_philosophy.name: The Tactical Communicator
design_philosophy.description: A high-precision, dark-mode dashboard that feels like a command center. It blends the familiarity of WhatsApp with the aesthetics of a developer's terminal. Functionality is king, but the visual language screams 'Power User'.
principles: Information Density: Use space efficiently but avoid clutter.
Visual Feedback: Every action (connect, disconnect, save) must have immediate visual confirmation.
Terminal Aesthetics: Use monospaced fonts for data, logs, and technical status.
The 'Alive' Interface: Use subtle pulses and glows to indicate active connections.

usage_rules: Use 'JetBrains Mono' for all Page Titles, Card Headers, and Metric Values.
Use 'Inter' for body text, chat messages, and descriptions.
Status labels (CONNECTED, OFF) must be Uppercase and Mono.

layout_structure.spacing_scale: Standard Tailwind spacing, but double it for section gaps (gap-8)

cards.style: bg-card border border-border/50 shadow-sm hover:border-primary/50 transition-colors duration-300

inputs.style: bg-secondary/50 border-input focus:border-primary focus:ring-1 focus:ring-primary transition-all font-mono text-sm

status_badge.style: inline-flex items-center px-2.5 py-0.5 rounded-full text-xs font-medium font-mono uppercase tracking-wider

visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use 'backdrop-blur-md' on sticky headers and overlays.
visual_enhancers.scanlines: Optional: Add a very subtle scanline overlay on the dashboard background using CSS gradients if possible, or keep it clean.
visual_enhancers.glow_effects: Use drop-shadows on the Primary Action buttons to simulate light emission.
visual_enhancers.icons: Use 'lucide-react'. Stroke width 1.5px for a crisp look.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text-gray-500 is not used on dark backgrounds. Use text-gray-400 or lighter.

elements: QR Code Container: Square, centered, with a scanning line animation overlay.
Instructions: Step-by-step list with numbered icons.

chat_viewer.style: Bordered container, full height minus header. Chat bubbles must be distinct.

logs.style: Terminal aesthetics. Black background, green/grey monospace text. Scrollable.

universal_guidelines: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories (especially sponsor logos) = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN
